iirc, the LTS are every two years: 8.04, 10.04, making the next 12.03
Can we upgrade from a non lts to a lts?
yes, the upgrade will be presented to you once 11.10 is official
the LTS is no different than any other release, if you upgrade every 6 months.
it's just for those who want long term consistency, LTS to LTS gives you 2 years without major changes
its even better since i got more recent software on no lts version?
sorry, I don't quite understand the question.
i think i prefer upgrading each 6 month and get latest software version
i will not necessary get into trouble if i choose a non lts version?

that is true, the LTS will not introduce new versions as quickly.  Once they are proven stable and useful, they probably wil get backported to LTS. But, no, sticking with 6 month releases will not get you into trouble. Installing the alphas probably will, and the betas could too :)

the only real reason to stick with LTS is for low-volume churn in the applications/user interface/etc.  As an example: the 11.04 introduction of Unity upset a lot of people.  LTS users would not even hear of Unity until 12.04
